messages.page_content:
Topic: Roll Call and Quorum Establishment
Summary: Roll call was conducted to establish the presence of council members at the meeting, with five members present and constituting a quorum. Two members arrived late.
Ordinance Number: N/A
Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (5 present, 2 absent)
Decision/Key Actions: Quorum established with five members present
Tags/Keywords: Roll Call, Quorum, Council Members, Meeting Presence
UID: 0373543f-784e-4488-b96f-57964300c295

- Topic: Communication from Theresa R. Becher, Council Research Officer, New Orleans City Council
- Summary: Theresa R. Becher submitted the recommended agenda items for deferrals for the July 15, 2021 Regular Council meeting.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Recommendation for deferrals submitted electronically and received.
- Tags/Keywords: Theresa R. Becher, deferral, agenda items, New Orleans City Council

- Topic: Communication from Erin Spears, Chief of Staff & Counsel, Council Utilities Regulatory Office
- Summary: Erin Spears submitted communications related to electric and gas utility matters to be received by the Council, including documents from Entergy New Orleans, LLC.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Documents related to electric and gas utility matters submitted for Council review.
- Tags/Keywords: Erin Spears, electric utility, gas utility, Entergy New Orleans, LLC

- Topic: Report on the Implementation of the General Service Customers’ Billing Annual Review Program for Customers in the Fifteenth Ward of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The report was submitted as per Resolution R-93-186, focusing on the implementation of the billing annual review program for customers in the Fifteenth Ward. 
- Ordinance Number: N/A

- Topic: Entergy's Non-Regulated Investments for the 2nd Quarter 2021
- Summary: The report was submitted as per the Rule 53 Settlement Agreement and Resolution R-98-187, providing an overview of Entergy's non-regulated investments for the 2nd quarter of 2021.

- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The report was submitted for informational purposes, and no specific decision or action was mentioned.

- Topic: Motion to Delay ENO’s 2021 Formula Rate Plan Filing Until July 19, 2021
- Summary: The motion was submitted to delay ENO’s 2021 Formula Rate Plan filing until July 19, 2021, as per UD-18-07.

- Topic: Communication from Jennifer Avegno, MD, Director of Health, City of New Orleans
- Summary: Jennifer Avegno submitted the Department of Health's June 2021 Monthly Report on encampment clean-up efforts as required by Section 82-703.

- Summary: Transmitting Zoning Dockets 48/21 and 51/21 with a hearing date set for 8/5/21.
- Ordinance Number: N/A

- Topic: Ordinance by Councilmember Gisleson Palmer
- Summary: The ordinance sought to rescind a previous ordinance related to zoning in the Central Business District.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,354
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.

- Topic: Ordinance by Councilmember Banks
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to amend and reordain specific articles of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,368
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: N/A
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning ordinance, amendment, reordain
- UID: 532d3f45-47f4-4f5f-9ef6-09cb7cc993f2

- Topic: Amendment to Zoning Ordinance to Define and Regulate Shooting Ranges
- Summary: The ordinance aims to create a definition and use standards for "shooting range" in appropriate districts, establish site design standards, and make any other necessary amendments. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33368 - 28736 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Shooting Range, Site Design Standards
- UID: d87b424d-d7cc-42a5-a77d-e5324abfbbe0

- Topic: Classification of "Dormitory" as a Permitted Use in CBD-1 Core Central Business District
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to classify "dormitory" as a permitted use in the CBD-1 Core Central Business District. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33369 - 28737 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, CBD-1, Dormitory
- UID: d87b424d-d7cc-42a5-a77d-e5324abfbbe0

- Topic: Amendment to Permit Extension of Wireless Telecommunications Tower
- Summary: This ordinance grants an amendment to permit the extension of a wireless telecommunications tower from 63.5 feet to 73.5 feet in specified districts. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33370 - 28738 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Wireless Telecommunications Tower, Zoning Amendment
- UID: d87b424d-d7cc-42a5-a77d-e5324abfbbe0

- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend various articles of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance of the City of New Orleans to ensure alignment with previously adopted legislation and to incorporate changes related to Inclusionary Zoning requirements. It includes provisions for parking reduction standards, definitions for inclusionary zoning voluntary provisions, and alignment of zoning use tables. The proposal applies to properties within designated Inclusionary Zoning Districts.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,371
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with electronic submission. It had a 90-day deadline for implementation.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Inclusionary Zoning, Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance, City Planning Commission
- UID: ae08c91f-3f28-4a9a-a06c-b8b710d48c64

- Topic: Minimum Wage Establishment
- Summary: This ordinance requires the Department of City Civil Service to evaluate and provide recommendations for amending the Classified Pay Plan to establish a minimum wage of $15 per hour. It aligns with Section 4-1503 of the Home Rule Charter.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,388
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted following the Budget Committee's recommendation for approval.
- Tags/Keywords: Minimum Wage, Department of City Civil Service, Classified Pay Plan
- UID: ae08c91f-3f28-4a9a-a06c-b8b710d48c64

- Topic: Campaign Contribution Restrictions
- Summary: This resolution prohibits Councilmembers from accepting campaign contributions from specific entities, including ENPAC, Council's Utility Advisors, and proposers or respondents to any RFQ or RFP issued by the Council in connection with public utilities regulation.
- Ordinance Number: RESOLUTION - NO. R-21-268
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution was adopted to restrict campaign contributions from specified entities related to public utilities regulation.
- Tags/Keywords: Campaign Contributions, Public Utilities Regulation, ENPAC, RFQ, RFP
- UID: ae08c91f-3f28-4a9a-a06c-b8b710d48c64

- Topic: Granting Non-Exclusive Franchise to McLeodUSA Telecommunications Services, LLC
- Summary: The ordinance grants a non-exclusive franchise to McLeodUSA Telecommunications Services, LLC, to construct, maintain, and operate a fiber-optic based communications system. The ordinance also provides for the furnishing of a surety bond and annual payments.
- Ordinance Number: 32930
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, and the consent agenda was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Franchise, Telecommunications, Fiber-optic, Communications, Surety Bond
- UID: 481c34b7-f06e-4c42-aa6a-a0ec2b161185

- Topic: Amendment to Section 26-15 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain Section 26-15 of the Code of the City of New Orleans, relating to peer review of structural design and inspection by engineers of record during construction. It specifies where such reviews and inspections are required, how and by whom they are to be performed.
- Ordinance Number: 33147
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the Meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to a future meeting for further discussion or action.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Structural Design, Inspection, Engineers, Construction
- UID: 481c34b7-f06e-4c42-aa6a-a0ec2b161185

- Topic: Amendment of Pardon Power and Marijuana Possession
- Summary: Ordinance introduced to clarify the pardon power of the Mayor and City Council, specifically to authorize the prospective pardon of marijuana possession.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,328
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Criminal Justice Committee, which recommended approval.
- Tags/Keywords: Pardon power, marijuana possession, Criminal Justice Committee
- UID: ba668afd-9f94-4d2c-8bc0-06bc94e5f005

- Topic: Enforcement of Smoke Free Air Act and Marijuana Smoking
- Summary: Ordinance introduced to authorize NOPD to enforce the Smoke Free Air Act only via summons and to prohibit the smoking of marijuana outside of a private residence.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,329
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Criminal Justice Committee, which recommended approval pending a technical correction.
- Tags/Keywords: Smoke Free Air Act, NOPD enforcement, marijuana smoking
- UID: ba668afd-9f94-4d2c-8bc0-06bc94e5f005

- Topic: Amendments to Marijuana Regulations
- Summary: Ordinance introduced to amend various sections of the City Code related to marijuana, including excluding marijuana testing from certain drug testing programs and clarifying policy officers' discretion not to issue summons for marijuana possession in certain circumstances.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,330
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Criminal Justice Committee for further review.
- Tags/Keywords: Marijuana regulations, drug testing, policy officers' discretion
- UID: ba668afd-9f94-4d2c-8bc0-06bc94e5f005

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Federal Grant Funds
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the operating budget to appropriate federal grant funds from Intergovernmental Transfers to the Mayor's Office of Homeland Security for FEMA reimbursement related costs.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,331
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the next meeting for further discussion and consideration.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Federal Grant Funds, Operating Budget, FEMA Reimbursement
- UID: fb7b8872-bc51-4806-9bd3-5057df191b38

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Federal Grant Funds
- Summary: This ordinance is similar to the previous one and also seeks to amend the operating budget to appropriate federal grant funds from Intergovernmental Transfers to the Mayor's Office of Homeland Security for FEMA reimbursement related costs.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,332
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the next meeting for further discussion and consideration.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Federal Grant Funds, Operating Budget, FEMA Reimbursement
- UID: fb7b8872-bc51-4806-9bd3-5057df191b38

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Economic Development
- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City and the BioDistrict New Orleans for the purpose of using undedicated taxes collected within the district to induce economic development and enhance bioscience and health products.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,349
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the next meeting for further discussion and consideration.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Economic Development, BioDistrict New Orleans
- UID: fb7b8872-bc51-4806-9bd3-5057df191b38

- Topic: Amendment to Short Term Rental Fund
- Summary: The ordinance aims to clarify the status of the City of New Orleans' Interim Short Term Rental Fund and its use for Short Term Rental enforcement. An amendment was proposed to remove a specific phrase and insert new language related to fee collection.
- Ordinance Number: 33,351 and 33,351 Amendment
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
    Vote 2: Amendment - Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance and its amendment were continued to the meeting of 8/5/21 for further discussion or decision.
- Tags/Keywords: Short Term Rental Fund, Amendment, Fee Collection
- UID: 66a90f2e-453d-4479-b87b-271837aedd0c

- Topic: Revenues Collected from Short Term Rentals
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend and clarify the revenues collected relative to the nightly occupancy of short term rentals that shall be deposited into the fund.
- Ordinance Number: 33,355
- Votes Summary: Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21 for further discussion or decision.
- Tags/Keywords: Short Term Rentals, Revenue Collection, Fund Deposits
- UID: 66a90f2e-453d-4479-b87b-271837aedd0c

- Topic: Servitude Agreement for 827 Canal Street
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into an agreement to grant a servitude to an adjacent property owner for encroachments on/over portions of public right-of-way located at 827 Canal Street. The ordinance passed.
- Ordinance Number: 33,363
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without any amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Servitude Agreement, Public Right-of-Way, 827 Canal Street
- UID: 2a4cdceb-4195-4b6f-8f28-3ac64208d086

- Topic: Servitude Agreement for 365 Canal Street
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into an agreement to grant a servitude to an adjacent property owner for encroachments on/over portions of public right-of-way located at 365 Canal Street. The ordinance passed.
- Ordinance Number: 33,364
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without any amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Servitude Agreement, Public Right-of-Way, 365 Canal Street
- UID: 2a4cdceb-4195-4b6f-8f28-3ac64208d086

- Topic: Ordinance to grant a lease for encroachments on public right-of-way at 800 France Street
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a lease agreement for encroachments on public right-of-way at 800 France Street, fixing the minimum price and terms of the lease. The use granted in the lease agreement will not interfere with the public right-of-way.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,365
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, allowing the Mayor to enter into the lease agreement for encroachments on public right-of-way at 800 France Street.
- UID: 6177f674-9922-49be-9c67-36c602f4caf7

- Topic: Ordinance to grant a servitude for encroachments on public right-of-way at 501 Decatur Street
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a servitude agreement for encroachments on public right-of-way at 501 Decatur Street, fixing the minimum price and terms of the servitude. The use granted in the servitude agreement will not interfere with the public right-of-way.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,366
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, allowing the Mayor to enter into the servitude agreement for encroachments on public right-of-way at 501 Decatur Street.
- UID: 6177f674-9922-49be-9c67-36c602f4caf7

- Topic: Lease Agreement at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport
- Summary: The ordinance approves and authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Lease Agreement at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport with SMI TRANSPORT, LLC.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,367
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

- Topic: Name Change of McDonough Playground to Harold DeVore Playground
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to change the name of McDonough Playground to Harold DeVore Playground.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,373
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to a future meeting.

- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the Operating Budget of Revenues for the City of New Orleans for the Year 2021 to appropriate State Capital Outlay Funds awarded by the State of Louisiana Facility Planning.

- Topic: Capital Outlay Funds for Sewerage and Water Board Power Plant Project
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate Capital Outlay Funds awarded by the State of Louisiana Facility Planning and Control to the City of New Orleans for the Sewerage and Water Board Power Plant Project. The vote was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21.

- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Appropriation of Funds for Police Secondary Employment
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to appropriate funds to increase revenues to the Office of Police Secondary Employment for police details due to the resumption of escorts and increased activity as the city returns to normalcy. The vote was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33,381
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21)

- Topic: Transfer of Funds for Health Department Programs
- Summary: This ordinance aims to transfer funds from CAO - Health General Fund to support the Health Department's School and Bike Safety Program, FIT NOLA Program, and others. The vote was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33,382
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Continued to the meeting of 8/5/21)
- Decision/Key Actions: Vote continued to a later meeting
- Tags/Keywords: Fund Transfer, Health Department Programs, CAO - Health General Fund
- UID: e9d50ceb-058d-4aae-a7ef-5455c318443d

- Topic: Appropriation of Funds for AmeriCorps VISTA Supervisor
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the operating budget to appropriate funds from AmeriCorps VISTA to the Office of the Mayor for hiring a supervisor for AmeriCorps VISTA sites in New Orleans. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,383
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)

- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend the operating budget to appropriate funds awarded by the Governor's Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness (GOHSEP) to the Office of Community Development for the Emergency Rental Assistance program. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,385
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)

- Topic: Motion - NO. M-21-260
- Summary: The motion directs the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance of the City of New Orleans to create a new use definition for a "City Hall."
- Ordinance Number: M-21-260
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was adopted with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.

- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: The City Planning Commission will conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance of the City of New Orleans to incorporate zoning standards that align with certain Future Land Use Map designations and provide incentives for developments with affordable housing components. The motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-264
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Directing the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing for the amendment.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Affordable Housing, City Planning Commission
- UID: a0d562bb-4c8d-41c2-8835-8268e838a852

- Topic: Adoption of Orleans Parish Hazard Mitigation Plan Update
- Summary: The council adopted the Orleans Parish Hazard Mitigation Plan Update in accordance with the Disaster Mitigation Act of 2000.

- Summary: The ordinance M-21-271 aimed to move the September 16, 2021, meeting to September 23, 2021.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-271
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopted - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)

- Topic: Reauthorization of Jerome "Big Duck" Smith Justice System Advisory Committee
- Summary: The ordinance M-21-272 aimed to reauthorize the committee for a one-year term beginning August 1, 2021, and ending on July 31, 2022.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-272
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopted - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)

- Summary: Request for a text amendment to the Comprehensive Zoning to modify use permissions and standards for child care centers in specific residential districts. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "FOR MODIFIED APPROVAL".
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO 45-21
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: HDLC Appeal for 435 Bouny Street
- Summary: The appeal requested retention of the removal of 2 brick chimneys at 435 Bouny Street, overturning the Historic District Landmarks Commission's denial.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-262
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The retention request was granted, overturning HDLC's denial.
- Tags/Keywords: HDLC, Appeal, Retention, Chimneys, Historic District Landmarks Commission

- Topic: Zoning Docket No. 26/21 for Kundan and Venna Louisiana, LLC
- Summary: The request was for a conditional use to permit a gas station in specific districts, with the recommendation of "FOR APPROVAL" subject to ten provisos.
- Ordinance Number: 26/21
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The request was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21 for further discussion and decision.
